page.title: 06Daily life in Sparkwell.
page.content:
My digital alarm clock wakes me at seven o'clock in the morning. I get up and have my breakfast of cornflakes and a boiled egg. At twenty-five to eleven I go to sing in the choir of Cornwood Church. Then I come home and play in the garden. At lunchtime we have salad and cold meat. Sometimes I play on our computer. We have a Commodore 64 with a disk drive, a printer and a tape recorder. For tea I have sausages and chips. At seven o'clock I go to hand-bell ringing. We play a lot of different tunes. Then I watch television and at half-past nine I go to bed.
Andrew Kane.
